name: North Longstrand
role_in_state: Northern fishing, salt and ship-repair hub
economy_niches: ritual navigational auguries for coastal routes
culture_adjustments: strong shipwright-guild prominence over kin-track leaders
distinct Coastal Tongues dialect with extra sea-lexicon
salt-worker seasonal subculture tied to brine-cycles
more frequent public augury rites integrated into market days
risks: seasonal supply isolation in winter storms
constraints: ritual auguries consume scarce imported reagents
limited fresh water for expanded saltworks
no high-pressure industrial tech for large-scale mechanization
notes: artisan-runic repair tradition concentrates skilled labor in few yard-hubs
market-days double as dispute-resolution forums and augury schedules
province follows state migratory rhythms; labor peaks at brine-harvest
